metadata.synopsis: The unfortunate gnome is playing with his powders, his mood downcast and face smeared with soot. He's learnt that the gnomes are at Moonrise. He'll ask us again to help them if we haven't agreed already. He has nodes to cover alternate states in HAV, but not as many as e.g. harpers. He is mostly concerned with Wulbren, and other matters are of little import to him.This dialogue will be expanded when we have clear messaging around what happened to the gnomes in HAV and how Barcus should react to them.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Loadlevel SCL_Main_AOpen debug book > Act 2 Setup > Tiefling PathIn debug book > Go to region > Haven > After Checkpoint > Just gogoto -59, 134Talk to Barcus

3.speaker: Barcus Wroot
3.text: There's something in the air. I don't like it.
3.context: NodeContext: Respnding to 'Perhaps what you're sensing is the shadowcurse'. Really, what Barcus is sensing is that Wulbren is dead.

152.speaker: Player
152.text: Could be the evil curse surrounding us.

94.speaker: Barcus Wroot
94.text: I don't know. I can't help but feel that something's... especially wrong. I mustn't let my imagination run away with me, though.

17.speaker: Barcus Wroot
17.context: NodeContext: Normal affect, Barcus' version of a decent mood

26.speaker: Barcus Wroot
26.text: Where in the world did everyone go? Quite the fuss, but I'm not sure why. You'll - you'll follow up, keep things in hand, won't you? Of course you will.

31.speaker: Barcus Wroot
31.text: Go on, then. No one but hang-abouts and n'er-do-muches here. And myself, of course.

221.speaker: Player
221.context: NodeContext: in response to "I'd like to trade"

74.speaker: Barcus Wroot
74.text: No. And pestering the craftsman won't speed things up!

79.speaker: Player
79.context: NodeContext: in response to "I'd like to trade"

103.speaker: Barcus Wroot
103.context: NodeContext: in response to "I'd like to trade"

129.speaker: Barcus Wroot
129.text: Now, if you're done rifling through my things...

186.speaker: Barcus Wroot
186.text: Now, if you're done rifling through my things...

54.speaker: Barcus Wroot
54.text: I say, are you quite all right? You look a little peaky.
54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barcus faints at the end of the nodeNodeContext: Player has just told Barcus that Wulbren is dead, and Barcus is trying to make sense of it. He's about to faint.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: I went to Moonrise Towers. All the captives there have perished.
96.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barcus faints at the end of the nodeNodeContext: Player has just told Barcus that Wulbren is dead, and Barcus is trying to make sense of it. He's about to faint.

136.speaker: Barcus Wroot
136.text: Perished... but that means... but Wulbren. How could it be...?

206.speaker: Player
206.text: I'm sorry, Barcus - Wulbren is dead.
206.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barcus faints at the end of the nodeNodeContext: Player has just told Barcus that Wulbren is dead, and Barcus is trying to make sense of it. He's about to faint.

6.speaker: Barcus Wroot
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barcus faints at the end of the nodeNodeContext: Player has just told Barcus that Wulbren is dead, and Barcus is trying to make sense of it. He's about to faint.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: I don't know what you mean.
27.context: NodeContext: REplying to player who is denying that anything's the matter.

88.speaker: Barcus Wroot
88.context: NodeContext: REplying to player who is denying that anything's the matter.

69.speaker: Barcus Wroot
69.context: NodeContext: After he fainted, Barcus wakes up and is a bit unsteady. He remembers Wulbren is dead and is trying to process. A bit dissociated

149.speaker: Barcus Wroot
149.text: Wulbren's gone. Wulbren's... dead. But. You know that.
149.context: NodeContext: Trying to put all the facts together, through the shock of losing Wulbren

150.speaker: Barcus Wroot
150.text: How can it be? I failed him so utterly.
150.context: NodeContext: With a cold edge; anger at hte death of Wulbren sinking in. Disgust on 'the Absolute'

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Wulbren got himself into this mess. It isn't your fault.
93.context: NodeContext: With a cold edge; anger at hte death of Wulbren sinking in. Disgust on 'the Absolute'

208.speaker: Barcus Wroot
208.text: He should never have joined those bloody Ironhand Gnomes. I told him, and I told him, and I told him. And now? Now he's dead.
208.context: NodeContext: With a cold edge; anger at hte death of Wulbren sinking in. Disgust on 'the Absolute'

75.speaker: Barcus Wroot
75.text: There's nothing I can do. It's over.
75.context: NodeContext: With a cold edge; anger at hte death of Wulbren sinking in. Disgust on 'the Absolute'

166.speaker: Barcus Wroot
166.text: That bloody cult has taken too much. They need to be stopped.
166.context: NodeContext: With a cold edge; anger at hte death of Wulbren sinking in. Disgust on 'the Absolute'

18.speaker: Barcus Wroot
18.text: The Brilliant Retort is ready. It's yours.
18.context: NodeContext: With a cold edge; anger at hte death of Wulbren sinking in. Disgust on 'the Absolute'

91.speaker: Barcus Wroot
91.text: Take it. And give the Absolute hell.
91.context: NodeContext: With a cold edge; anger at hte death of Wulbren sinking in. Disgust on 'the Absolute'

67.speaker: Barcus Wroot
67.text: While you were infiltrating the Towers, I was working on something I thought might help in the fight against those cultists.

141.speaker: Barcus Wroot
141.text: It's new type of smokepowder. Plenty of firepower in it, but with an extra surprise. Sure to take those cultists down a short road, if you catch my meaning.

66.speaker: Barcus Wroot
66.text: I call it the Brilliant Retort. Seems a bit glib now - but it would've made Wulbren smile, I think.

25.speaker: Barcus Wroot
25.text: It's up to you. You're the only one capable of it. Crush them.

13.speaker: Player
13.context: NodeContext: Response to 'what will you do now that Wulbren's dead'. He cant fathom an answer

42.speaker: Barcus Wroot
42.text: I'll... well. I'll... I'm not sure.
42.context: NodeContext: Response to 'what will you do now that Wulbren's dead'. He cant fathom an answer

180.speaker: Barcus Wroot
180.text: It's too late for Wulbren. For me. But not for others. Nor for you.

123.speaker: Barcus Wroot
123.text: A terrible thing, isn't it? A terrible thing, to try your best and get nowhere at all.

43.speaker: Barcus Wroot
43.text: Or worse - to try your best and end up hurting the one you love the most.

114.speaker: Barcus Wroot
114.text: What a brutal horror this life can be.

85.speaker: Barcus Wroot
85.text: Ah - you found your way. Good.
85.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the player approaches, Barcus is still facing his work bench, inspecting beakers of powder in the light. With his back turned to player, without looking up, he addresses the player..

153.speaker: Player
153.context: NodeContext: answering 'you were supposed to wait at camp.'

71.speaker: Barcus Wroot
71.text: I thought I'd scout ahead. Check for any nasty surprises. Of which I found a great deal.
71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barcus turns to face playerNodeContext: Grave but wry; Barcus turns to face the player

127.context: NodeContext: Grim, but at the mention of the workbench he can't help but light up a little. He's an inventor at heart and is very enthused.

145.speaker: Player
145.context: NodeContext: Grim, but at the mention of the workbench he can't help but light up a little. He's an inventor at heart and is very enthused.

199.speaker: Barcus Wroot
199.text: Shades. Death. Harpers. Flaming Fist. And this, of course. And the makings of an alchemist's workbench. Ingredients, too.
199.context: NodeContext: Grim, but at the mention of the workbench he can't help but light up a little. He's an inventor at heart and is very enthused.

8.speaker: Barcus Wroot
8.text: There's a recipe I'm trying to replicate. Something that might help you.
8.context: NodeContext: He's a bit shy about being vulnerable by being friendly to you, but trying to play it cool

15.speaker: Barcus Wroot
15.text: That is - if you're still going to help Wulbren and the others.

159.speaker: Barcus Wroot
159.text: In that case, you'll be very pleased to learn what I have in store for you.

176.speaker: Player
176.text: Depends. What did you say you were making?

204.speaker: Player
204.text: I help a lot of people - remind me who you mean?

171.speaker: Barcus Wroot
171.text: The deep gnomes at the Towers, of course! And Wulbren among them, if he's to be found.

61.speaker: Barcus Wroot
61.text: Aren't you some kind of wandering hero? Isn't this what you do?

105.speaker: Player
105.text: I suppose I've earned the reputation. I'll help find your friends.
105.context: NodeContext: A quiet, intimate plea encased with his stoicism.

106.speaker: Barcus Wroot
106.text: If anyone can, I'm certain it's you. But you won't do it alone. I'm working on a recipe to help you on your way.
106.context: NodeContext: A quiet, intimate plea encased with his stoicism.

14.speaker: Barcus Wroot
14.text: A new type of smokepowder. All the bang and boom of the original, but with an extra surprise. I call it the Brilliant Retort.
14.context: NodeContext: A quiet, intimate plea encased with his stoicism.

216.speaker: Barcus Wroot
216.text: You'll need it if you're going to survive this cursed place.
216.context: NodeContext: A quiet, intimate plea encased with his stoicism.

209.speaker: Barcus Wroot
209.text: You'll need it if you're going to get into Moonrise Towers and help the deep gnomes taken prisoner there.
209.context: NodeContext: A quiet, intimate plea encased with his stoicism.

19.speaker: Barcus Wroot
19.text: You'll need it if you're going to save Wulbren.
19.context: NodeContext: A quiet, intimate plea encased with his stoicism.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: I thought that was your mission.

211.speaker: Barcus Wroot
211.text: Let's call a thing a thing: a deep gnome won't get far into the Absolute's orgy of evil. We already learned that in the Underdark with those sadistic duergar, didn't we? It's doubly true in this place.

112.speaker: Barcus Wroot
112.text: You, on the other hand, have proven resourceful in such infiltrations.

226.speaker: Player
226.text: How did deep gnomes get trapped in the Towers?

102.speaker: Barcus Wroot
102.text: They didn't get trapped, they were kidnapped! Taken against their will by those cultists. If I ever get my hands on one of them... well. With you on the job, perhaps I won't have to find out.

160.speaker: Barcus Wroot
160.text: I'll do my part according to my talents, and you, I hope, will do yours.

213.speaker: Barcus Wroot
213.text: The Brilliant Retort will aid you. Thus, I will make it.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: Anything I can do to help?

230.speaker: Barcus Wroot
230.text: Unless you've got access to a 300-year-old Tempusian apothecarial almanac, no.

20.speaker: Barcus Wroot
20.text: But - that's for me to worry about.

131.speaker: Barcus Wroot
131.text: You - you do whatever it is you do.

151.speaker: Barcus Wroot
151.text: Some of us are counting on you.

164.speaker: Player
164.text: I'll keep an eye out for your friends, but no promises.
164.context: NodeContext: He's haphazardly using flattery; he's not used to resorting to it.

161.speaker: Barcus Wroot
161.text: I seek not promises, my friend, but deeds worthy of your prodigious talents.
161.context: NodeContext: He's haphazardly using flattery; he's not used to resorting to it.

228.speaker: Barcus Wroot
228.text: Now! You - off to your... heroism, as it were.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: I like the name. What's it do?

119.speaker: Barcus Wroot
119.text: Let's not ruin the surprise, hmm?

178.speaker: Player
178.text: Sounds good. But I haven't forgotten you also promised me a reward once I've saved your friend.

36.speaker: Barcus Wroot
36.text: Nor have I. Everything in its due course, hmm? First, the Brilliant Retort. Then, Wulbren. Then, your reward.

167.speaker: Player
167.text: I have more important things to do.
167.context: NodeContext: He softens. His 'insult' to the player isn't serious. He knows you're his best bet and he says this wryly, not meant to insult.

225.speaker: Barcus Wroot
225.text: Whatever it is, I'm sure the rescue of a few innocent citizens will round it out nicely.

196.speaker: Player
196.context: NodeContext: He softens. His 'insult' to the player isn't serious. He knows you're his best bet and he says this wryly, not meant to insult.

219.speaker: Barcus Wroot
219.text: A friend. I'd do anything to find him. Including trusting his fate to the likes of you.
219.context: NodeContext: He softens. His 'insult' to the player isn't serious. He knows you're his best bet and he says this wryly, not meant to insult.

33.speaker: Player
33.context: NodeContext: With a twinge of irony. Barcus realizes he's being a bit excessive in pursuing Wulbren this far, but there's no 2 ways about it. He'd do anything to save his dumbass friend.

59.speaker: Barcus Wroot
59.text: An old friend. The kind one doesn't simply leave to his own reckless fate - even when it leads to the heart of a murderous cult.
59.context: NodeContext: With a twinge of irony. Barcus realizes he's being a bit excessive in pursuing Wulbren this far, but there's no 2 ways about it. He'd do anything to save his dumbass friend.

175.speaker: Player
175.text: I did - though with a few hiccups along the way.
175.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barcus turns to face player NodeContext: He turns to face the player

12.speaker: Barcus Wroot
12.text: Nasty place, isn't it. My torch only just held out long enough for me to find my way here.
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barcus turns to face player NodeContext: He turns to face the player

133.speaker: Player
133.text: I told you I'd help rescue Wulbren and the others - this is my first stop.
133.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Barcus turns to face player
 NodeContext: He's quite excited by what you've said, but trying to play it down in classic Barcus fashion. He turns around on 'And as it happens, I was making something to help you on your way.'

46.speaker: Barcus Wroot
46.text: I haven't forgotten. And as it happens, I was making something to help you on your way.
46.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Barcus turns to face player
 NodeContext: He's quite excited by what you've said, but trying to play it down in classic Barcus fashion. He turns around on 'And as it happens, I was making something to help you on your way.'

220.speaker: Player
220.text: Hadn't expected to find this place. I'm trying to get into the Towers.
220.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Barcus turns to face player
 NodeContext: He turns to face the player here. He's sincere, but deadpan in his delivery. He's not one to betray emotion, but he does speak facts unbegrudgingly.

47.speaker: Barcus Wroot
47.text: If anyone can, I'm sure it's you.
47.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Barcus turns to face player
 NodeContext: He turns to face the player here. He's sincere, but deadpan in his delivery. He's not one to betray emotion, but he does speak facts unbegrudgingly.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: What are you doing here, anyway?

203.speaker: Barcus Wroot
203.text: I decided to scout ahead and get the lay of the land.

177.speaker: Barcus Wroot
177.text: It didn't seem right to let you do all the work. And as it happens, I've cobbled together something of an alchemist's workbench here in this inn.

95.speaker: Barcus Wroot
95.text: Your work here isn't done. So perhaps you should get on with it.
95.context: NodeContext: He's terrified and heartbroken but trying to hold it together.

120.speaker: Barcus Wroot
120.context: NodeContext: He's terrified and heartbroken but trying to hold it together.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: I'm afraid he didn't make it.
65.context: NodeContext: Reeling, having just heard Wulbren is dead. He's having trouble wrappng his head around this. Decimated.

128.speaker: Barcus Wroot
128.text: That's what the others said. And yet... and yet... how could it be?
128.context: NodeContext: Reeling, having just heard Wulbren is dead. He's having trouble wrappng his head around this. Decimated.

130.speaker: Barcus Wroot
130.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barcus faints at the end of the nodeNodeContext: Woozy, losing consciousness, full line would be 'How could it be that Wulbren is dead?'

154.speaker: Player
154.text: Talk to your friends about it. It's none of my business.
154.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barcus faints at the end of the nodeNodeContext: Losing consciousness, about to faint

182.speaker: Barcus Wroot
182.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barcus faints at the end of the nodeNodeContext: Losing consciousness, about to faint

11.speaker: Barcus Wroot
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barcus faints at the end of the nodeNodeContext: Losing consciousness, about to faint

217.speaker: Player
217.text: The cult has probably taken him for parts by now. Oh well.
217.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barcus faints at the end of the nodeNodeContext: GEtting ready to faint, then faints

146.speaker: Barcus Wroot
146.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barcus faints at the end of the nodeNodeContext: GEtting ready to faint, then faints

125.speaker: Barcus Wroot
125.context: NodeContext: Sad, post poor outcome for Wulbren

4.speaker: Barcus Wroot
4.text: Fortunately for me, you do. There was a rather compromising incident at a windmill, and another with some duergar.

165.speaker: Barcus Wroot
165.text: I can't tell if you're my good luck charm, or an omen of my every misfortunate.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Ah, of course. How are things, Barcus?

118.speaker: Barcus Wroot
118.text: How are things? How are things?

138.speaker: Barcus Wroot
138.text: I'll soon be off to Moonrise Towers to look for my friend Wulbren. I understand you might be headed in that direction as well.

144.speaker: Player
144.text: I have reason to believe the seat of the Absolute is in Moonrise.

83.speaker: Barcus Wroot
83.text: I'm sure I'll have no problem locating Wulbren and skipping out of there hand in hand!

63.speaker: Player
63.text: You understand correctly. But it would be suicide for you to go near the place.
63.context: NodeContext: With a twinge of irony. Barcus realizes he's being a bit excessive in pursuing Wulbren this far, but there's no 2 ways about it. He'd do anything to save his dumbass friend.

72.speaker: Barcus Wroot
72.text: Don't threaten me with a good time. My search for Wulbren has been one quagmire after another, as you know.

163.speaker: Barcus Wroot
163.text: Still. A friend is a friend. And Wulbren won't last long in a place as dreadful as the Towers.

44.speaker: Player
44.context: NodeContext: With a twinge of irony. Barcus realizes he's being a bit excessive in pursuing Wulbren this far, but there's no 2 ways about it. He'd do anything to save his dumbass friend.

53.speaker: Barcus Wroot
53.text: An old friend. The kind one doesn't simply leave to his own reckless fate - even when it leads to the heart of a murderous cult!
53.context: NodeContext: With a twinge of irony. Barcus realizes he's being a bit excessive in pursuing Wulbren this far, but there's no 2 ways about it. He'd do anything to save his dumbass friend.

57.speaker: Barcus Wroot
57.text: If he's there, I plan to find him.
57.context: NodeContext: Losing confidence in his own abilities.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: Even if you get past the shadow curse, you'll never make it past that many cultists.
70.context: NodeContext: Losing confidence in his own abilities.

56.speaker: Barcus Wroot
56.text: I'm sure I'll come up with... something.
56.context: NodeContext: Losing confidence in his own abilities.

183.speaker: Player
183.text: I'm going to Moonrise Towers, too. Why don't you let me look for him.

168.speaker: Barcus Wroot
168.text: You wouldn't even know what he looks like.

155.speaker: Barcus Wroot
155.text: Then again, my track record is... well. Discouraging.
155.context: NodeContext: Coming around, realizing he might not be best-suited to find Wulbren.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Then it's settled. You stay here. I'll search the Towers.
64.context: NodeContext: Quite grateful but not used to showing it.

89.speaker: Barcus Wroot
89.text: That's very decent of you. Very decent of you indeed.
89.context: NodeContext: Quite grateful but not used to showing it.

32.speaker: Barcus Wroot
32.text: But! I won't stand idle. I've spotted an alchemist's scales and had already been cooking up a little something that might help against those cultists.
32.context: NodeContext: Wants to be useful, getting back to his old perfunctory self.

23.speaker: Barcus Wroot
23.text: I'll get to work on the Brilliant Retort. You get to work at the Towers. Deal?

48.speaker: Barcus Wroot
48.text: A new type of smokepowder. All the bang and boom of the original, but with an extra surprise. Guaranteed to end any and all arguments or protestations.

39.speaker: Barcus Wroot
39.text: Very good, very good. Very good indeed!

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Give me the schematics for the Brilliant Retort and we have a deal.

229.speaker: Barcus Wroot
229.text: Don't be ridiculous - if I give you the schematics, how in all of Toril am I supposed to make the damn thing?

212.speaker: Player
212.text: I don't work for free. Throw in the plans for what you're working on and I'll consider.

181.speaker: Barcus Wroot
181.text: Please. I'll make it extra explosive. Just for you.

223.speaker: Barcus Wroot
223.text: Disappointment. The raisin cookie of the soul.

0.speaker: Barcus Wroot
0.text: Very well! I wish you a safe journey. Perhaps I'll see you on the road to the Towers.

143.speaker: Barcus Wroot
143.text: But with a little luck, perhaps I won't.

201.speaker: Player
201.text: Seems you can handle things yourself.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: I'll leave you to consider it.

210.speaker: Barcus Wroot
210.text: Wait! Wait. I may be proud, but I'm no fool. If Wulbren is to be found, you stand the best chance of finding him.

218.speaker: Barcus Wroot
218.text: If you'll agree to look for him, I'll make myself useful here. I've spotted an alchemist's scales and had already been dreaming up a little something to help fight off those loathsome cultists.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Do as you wish, but I won't rescue you a third time.
9.context: NodeContext: Sarcastic. In response to the player being snarky.

190.speaker: Barcus Wroot
190.context: NodeContext: Sarcastic. In response to the player being snarky.

29.speaker: Barcus Wroot
29.text: Then again... if you're going to the Towers... it stands to reason you might encounter Wulbren while you're there.

45.speaker: Barcus Wroot
45.text: Perhaps we ought to allocate our resources intelligently. According to our talents, as it were.

2.speaker: Barcus Wroot
2.text: Wulbren needs a hero. Someone like you. And you need a way to protect yourself against the forces of evil, hm?

214.speaker: Player
214.text: How did you make your way through the shadows?

92.speaker: Barcus Wroot
92.text: It helps to know when to close your eyes and run. I bumped into this inn before any nasty shadows got their tendrils on me.

224.speaker: Barcus Wroot
224.text: Now, I've only to find my way into the Towers...

107.speaker: Player
107.text: Seems you've found yourself in another scrape.

184.speaker: Barcus Wroot
184.text: Out of one, really. It took a bit of nimble footwork to make it through the darkness un-cursed.

192.speaker: Barcus Wroot
192.text: Luckily, I found this place. As have you.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Indeed. I found this place on my way to Moonrise Towers.
16.context: NodeContext: Putting on a bit of an act, miming helplessness that masks his cynicism

116.speaker: Barcus Wroot
116.text: There are deep gnomes being held in Moonrise Towers. One of them is my friend Wulbren.

198.speaker: Player
198.context: NodeContext: Putting on a bit of an act, miming helplessness that masks his cynicism

86.speaker: Player
86.text: I hope you got a warmer welcome than I.
86.context: NodeContext: Putting on a bit of an act, miming helplessness that masks his cynicism

62.speaker: Barcus Wroot
62.text: That seems likely. Everyone loves providing refuge for a poor, defenceless deep gnome.
62.context: NodeContext: Putting on a bit of an act, miming helplessness that masks his cynicism

30.speaker: Barcus Wroot
30.text: I was about to ask you the same. I'm going to Moonrise Towers in search of my friend Wulbren.

195.speaker: Barcus Wroot
195.text: And you're doing... general heroism, I believe it is?

122.speaker: Player
122.text: What happened to the other gnomes you were with?

205.speaker: Barcus Wroot
205.context: CinematicNodeContext: He runs off from the player to go find Wulbren, who's in the other room.NodeContext: Disbelief, then excitement as he realizes Wulbren is in the other room

126.speaker: Barcus Wroot
126.text: Everyone seems to be quite a-flutter. Do you know why?
126.context: CinematicNodeContext: He runs off from the player to go find Wulbren, who's in the other room.NodeContext: Disbelief, then excitement as he realizes Wulbren is in the other room

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Are you joking? Barcus, Wulbren is right in the other room.
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: He runs off from the player to go find Wulbren, who's in the other room.NodeContext: Disbelief, then excitement as he realizes Wulbren is in the other room

137.speaker: Barcus Wroot
137.context: CinematicNodeContext: He runs off from the player to go find Wulbren, who's in the other room.NodeContext: Disbelief, then excitement as he realizes Wulbren is in the other room

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Haven't you heard? I freed the people being held in Moonrise Towers.
78.context: CinematicNodeContext: He runs off from the player to go find Wulbren, who's in the other room.NodeContext: Surprised and excited

111.speaker: Barcus Wroot
111.text: You - you did? But that means... Wulbren!
111.context: CinematicNodeContext: He runs off from the player to go find Wulbren, who's in the other room.NodeContext: Surprised and excited

73.speaker: Player
73.text: I did what you asked. Ready for my reward.
73.context: NodeContext: Urgently wants to go find Wulbren, who's been found; happy.

188.speaker: Barcus Wroot
188.text: You mean - but that means - Wulbren.
188.context: NodeContext: Urgently wants to go find Wulbren, who's been found; happy.

76.speaker: Barcus Wroot
76.context: NodeContext: Urgently wants to go find Wulbren, who's been found; happy.

50.speaker: Barcus Wroot
50.text: A new type of smokepowder. I call it the Brilliant Retort. It's yours! Now - I need to go find Wulbren!

202.speaker: Barcus Wroot
202.text: I give you: The Brilliant Retort! Now - I need to go find Wulbren!

28.speaker: Barcus Wroot
28.text: Huh? It... seems to have disappeared.

148.speaker: Barcus Wroot
148.text: Dear me. That's quite a loss. But! Oh well! Wulbren's back!

222.speaker: Barcus Wroot
222.text: A-ha. I was hoping you'd find this place. Thought you might've fallen in a hole. I'm pleased to see you, but I think there's something happening at the Towers. You like heroism, don't you? Might be of interest.
